member.name: T:FastEndpoints.IJobStorageProvider`1
member.summary: interface for defining the contract of a job storage provider
member.typeparam: the type of job storage record of this storage provider

member.name: M:FastEndpoints.IJobStorageProvider`1.StoreJobAsync(`0,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: store the job storage record however you please. ideally on a nosql database.
member.param: the job storage record which contains the actual command object as well as some metadata

member.name: M:FastEndpoints.IJobStorageProvider`1.GetNextBatchAsync(FastEndpoints.PendingJobSearchParams{`0})
member.summary: fetch the next pending batch of job storage records that need to be processed, with the supplied search parameters.
member.param: use these supplied search parameters to find the next batch of job records from your database

member.name: M:FastEndpoints.IJobStorageProvider`1.MarkJobAsCompleteAsync(`0,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: mark the job storage record as complete by either replacing the entity on storage with the supplied instance or simply update the field to true with a partial update operation.
member.param: the job storage record to mark as complete
cancellation token

member.name: M:FastEndpoints.IJobStorageProvider`1.CancelJobAsync(System.Guid,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: either delete the job storage record from the db using the supplied tracking id or update the field to true with a partial update operation.
member.param: the of the job to be cancelled
cancellation token

member.name: M:FastEndpoints.IJobStorageProvider`1.OnHandlerExecutionFailureAsync(`0,System.Exception,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
this will only be triggered when a command handler () associated with a command throws an exception. If you've set an execution time limit for the command, the thrown exception would be of type .
when a job/command execution fails, it will be retried immediately. the failed job will be fetched again with the next batch of pending jobs. if one or more jobs keep failing repeatedly, it may cause the whole queue to get stuck in a retry loop preventing it from progressing.
to prevent this from happening and allow other jobs to be given a chance at execution, you can reschedule failed jobs to be re-attempted at a future time instead. simply update the property to a future date/time and save the entity to the database (or do a partial update of only that property value).
member.param: the job that failed to execute successfully
the exception that was thrown
cancellation token

member.name: M:FastEndpoints.IJobStorageProvider`1.PurgeStaleJobsAsync(FastEndpoints.StaleJobSearchParams{`0})
member.summary: this method will be called hourly. implement this method to delete stale records (completed or expired) from storage. you can safely delete the completed records. the incomplete & expired records can be moved to some other location (dead-letter-queue maybe) or for inspection by a human. or if you'd like to retry expired events, update the field to a future date/time.
member.param: use these supplied search parameters to find stale job records from your database

member.name: T:FastEndpoints.IJobStorageRecord
member.summary: the contract for a job storage record entity

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.IJobStorageRecord.QueueID
member.summary: a unique id for the job queue. each command type has its own queue. this is automatically generated by the library.

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.IJobStorageRecord.TrackingID
member.summary: a unique id used to track a particular job for the purpose of progress monitoring and/or termination.

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.IJobStorageRecord.Command
member.summary:
the actual command object that will be embedded in the storage record. if your database/orm (such as ef-core) doesn't support embedding objects, you can take the following steps:
1. add a [NotMapped] attribute to this property. 2. add a new property, either a string or byte[] 3. implement both GetCommand() and SetCommand() methods to serialize/deserialize the command object back and forth and store it in the newly added property.
you may use any serializer you please. recommendation is to use MessagePack.

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.IJobStorageRecord.ExecuteAfter
member.summary: the job will not be executed before this date/time. by default, it will automatically be set to the time of creation allowing jobs to be executed as soon as they're created.

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.IJobStorageRecord.ExpireOn
member.summary: the expiration date/time of job. if the job remains in an incomplete state past this time, the record is considered stale, and will be marked for removal from storage.

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.IJobStorageRecord.IsComplete
member.summary: indicates whether the job has successfully completed or not.

member.name: M:FastEndpoints.IJobStorageRecord.GetCommand``1
member.summary: implement this function to customize command deserialization.

member.name: M:FastEndpoints.IJobStorageRecord.SetCommand``1(``0)
member.summary: implement this method to customize command serialization.

member.name: T:FastEndpoints.IJobResultStorage
member.summary: addon interface to enable storage of job results on a job storage record ()

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.IJobResultStorage.Result
member.summary:
the actual result object that will be embedded in the storage record. if your database/orm (such as ef-core) doesn't support embedding objects, you can take the following steps:
1. add a [NotMapped] attribute to this property. 2. add a new property, either a string or byte[] 3. implement both GetResult() and SetResult() methods to serialize/deserialize the command object back and forth and store it in the newly added property.
you may use any serializer you please. recommendation is to use MessagePack.

member.name: M:FastEndpoints.IJobResultStorage.GetResult``1
member.summary: implement this function to customize the result deserialization.

member.name: M:FastEndpoints.IJobResultStorage.SetResult``1(``0)
member.summary: implement this method to customize the result serialization.

member.name: T:FastEndpoints.IHasCommandType
member.summary: implement this interface on your job storage record if you'd like to persist the full type name of the command class which is associated with the storage record. you don't need to set the value yourself as it will be automatically set by the system.

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.IHasCommandType.CommandType
member.summary: the full type name of the command

member.exception: thrown when no commands/handlers have been detected

member.summary: enable job queue functionality with given settings
member.param: specify settings/execution limits for each job queue type
member.exception: thrown when no commands/handlers have been detected

member.name: M:FastEndpoints.JobQueueExtensions.TriggerJobExecution``1
member.summary: triggers the execution of jobs in the respective queue for that command type.
member.typeparam: the command type used to determine which queue to trigger

member.name: M:FastEndpoints.JobQueueExtensions.QueueJobAsync(FastEndpoints.ICommandBase,System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: queues up a given command in the respective job queue for that command type.
member.param: the command to be queued
if set, the job won't be executed before this date/time. if unspecified, execution is attempted as soon as possible.
if set, job will be considered stale/expired after this date/time. if unspecified, jobs expire after 4 hours of creation.
cancellation token
member.exception: thrown if the and arguments are not UTC values

member.typeparam: the type of your concrete class

member.name: T:FastEndpoints.JobQueueOptions
member.summary: options for job queues

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.JobQueueOptions.MaxConcurrency
member.summary: the default max concurrency per job type. default value is the number of logical processors of the computer. you can specify per queue type overrides using

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.JobQueueOptions.StorageProbeDelay
member.summary: specifies the interval for periodic re-checks of the storage to detect any scheduled jobs. these checks ensure that re-scheduled jobs are promptly executed. the default interval is set to 60 seconds. a shorter delay will make re-scheduled jobs run faster but will increase the overall load on the storage system, due to too frequent queries being issued. only reduce this delay if you need re-scheduled jobs re-execute faster.

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.JobQueueOptions.ExecutionTimeLimit
member.summary: the per job type max execution time limit for handler executions unless otherwise overridden using defaults to .

member.name: M:FastEndpoints.JobQueueOptions.LimitsFor``1(System.Int32,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: specify execution limits such a max concurrency and execution time limit for a given command type.
member.typeparam: the type of the command the limits apply to
member.param: the maximum number of command executions of the same command type that's allowed to execute at the same time
the maximum amount of time each command is allowed to execute for. when execution time exceeds this value, a will be thrown. when that happens you can handle it in the method.

member.name: T:FastEndpoints.IJobTracker`1
member.summary: the interface defining a job tracker
member.typeparam: the command type of the job

member.name: M:FastEndpoints.IJobTracker`1.CancelJobAsync(System.Guid,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: cancel a job by its tracking id. if the job is currently executing, the cancellation token passed down to the command handler method will be notified of the cancellation. the job storage record will also be marked complete via method of the job storage provider, which will prevent the job from being picked up for execution.
member.param: the job tracking id
optional cancellation token
member.exception: this method will throw any exceptions that the job storage provider may throw in case of transient errors. you can safely retry calling this method repeatedly with the same tracking id.

member.name: M:FastEndpoints.IJobTracker`1.StoreJobResultAsync``1(System.Guid,``0,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: this method can be used to either store a preliminary job result and/or job progress before the job execution fully completes.
member.param: the job tracking id
the preliminary job result or progress to store
cancellation token
member.typeparam: the type of the preliminary result or progress

member.name: M:FastEndpoints.IJobTracker`1.GetJobResultAsync``1(System.Guid,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: retrieve the result of a command (that returns a result) which was previously queued as a job. the returned result will be null/default until the job is actually complete.
member.param: the job tracking id
cancellation token
member.typeparam: the type of the expected result

member.name: T:FastEndpoints.PendingJobSearchParams`1
member.summary: a dto representing search parameters for pending job storage record retrieval

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.PendingJobSearchParams`1.QueueID
member.summary: the ID of the job queue for fetching the next batch of records for.

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.PendingJobSearchParams`1.Match
member.summary:
a boolean lambda expression to match the next batch of records
r => r.QueueID == "xxx" && !r.IsComplete && DateTime.UtcNow >= r.ExecuteAfter && DateTime.UtcNow <= r.ExpireOn

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.PendingJobSearchParams`1.Limit
member.summary: the number of pending records to fetch

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.PendingJobSearchParams`1.CancellationToken
member.summary: cancellation token

member.name: T:FastEndpoints.StaleJobSearchParams`1
member.summary: a dto representing search parameters for matching stale job storage records

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.StaleJobSearchParams`1.Match
member.summary:
a boolean lambda expression to match stale job records
r => r.IsComplete || r.ExpireOn <= DateTime.UtcNow

member.name: P:FastEndpoints.StaleJobSearchParams`1.CancellationToken
member.summary: cancellation token
